item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG LEFT AT HAZMAT CAGE FOR HAZMAT TRAINED QA. PKG CAME OUT OF 869-GDRS-N TRAILER 452118 WET FROM ANOTHER DAMAGED HAZMAT PKG INSIDE TRAILER. THE BOX FOR THIS HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED AND HAZMAT PKGS CANNOT BE REPACKED DescribePack: NO DAMAGE TO CONTENTS INSIDE PACKAGE. ONLY DAMAGE WAS TO EXTERNAL BOX DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: IN HOUSE CLEAN UP

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of one coat green (un2922) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner poly 1 gallon can had released 1 cup of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023090299
item.description:
Report E-2023090299

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a 2-pint release of UN1993 “Unisol Liquid Red BK-50” that was released from a 250-gallon metal tote containing residual material. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed a 2-pint release of material from a 250-gallon metal tote impacting a 2’ x 2’ area on the tote and a few drops on the trailer. Contractors collected the released product and impacted pads and damaged tote lid into a 30-gallon and 55-gallon metal drums. The tote lid was successfully replaced for shipment on. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081997
item.description:
Report X-2023081997

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

item.title: Report X-2023081153
item.description:
Report X-2023081153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The jerrican was found on the floor between the 5&6 load areas sitting in a puddle of it's own liquid which damaged some of the shipping label and the manufacturer's container label as well as the OP-900. It appears that it toppled off the end of the conveyor belt and cracked because the tape on the closure was still intact and not damaged. When it was discovered, the container was placed in a hazmat bag and brought to the QA area for further investigation. DescribePack: It appears that there is a crack in the bottom welded seam DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When it was discovered, the container was placed in a hazmat bag and brought to the QA area for further investigation.
